So, "nap" is the only plausible option here. It makes sense because people often take naps in the afternoon to rejuvenate.

Additionally, "nap" is a common term used in many languages, not just English. For example, in Spanish, "siesta" is a similar concept, but the word "nap" itself is English.

It's interesting how languages have different terms for similar concepts. In English, "nap" specifically refers to a short sleep taken during waking hours, usually in the afternoon.

Sometimes, people also take power naps, which are even shorter, around 10-20 minutes, to boost alertness and productivity.
